column4: well i was thinking as long as i use a light weight window manager should be okay
this new updated install is just under 5gb.
how much ram do you have?
128 mb
you got 128mb of RAM? thats going to be a Major bottleneck
you would want a lot of swap in that case
so at minimum 256 mb swap?
i would check out Lubuntu for such a low end system
id say a min of 512mb-1gb..
whats its CPU anyway?
i think 333mhz
try lubuntu, if thats too sluggish. You may have to go try these super-minimal type disrtos liek Puppylinux, or dsl, or others.
it also may take you a few hrs to install on such a low end box.
i put it on a Pent I 100mhz once.. ages ago. :) just the install took like 2 hrs..
i wouldnt be surprised if it took longer i don't think the cd drive reads very fast
also 'tiny core linux' = 10mb :)
that old a machine may ba a problem on any disrto
on a 333mhz machine.. i dont think 'fast' is a word that should be used with anything, :)
ive never heard of that before
they can use quite a bit.
i was thinking the same thing they play alot of those spam apps on facebook lol...
more correct is to say 'flash is buggy' :)
